intro: Kentrophyllum baeticum, commonly known as the Baetican kentrophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant thrives in rocky, calcareous soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are typically narrow and lanceolate, with a distinctive silvery underside. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
